block.p: Not all Texas murder defendants get a decent courtroom defense. Not in the case of Delma Banks Jr., who was sent to death row in 1980. His lawyer, a former district attorney, failed ''to investigate or interview punishment-phase witnesses,'' a federal magistrate later found. On Aug. 18, David Folsom, a Federal District judge in Texarkana, Tex., endorsed that finding, which was first reported Wednesday in The Texarkana Gazette, and ordered either a sentence reduction or new sentencing trial for Mr. Banks.
